SENT.plain: At the age of 20 years, a Japanese man with recurrent oral aphthae, genital ulcers, folliculitis, erythema nodosum, episodic arthritis and epididymitis was diagnosed as having Behcet's disease (BD) in 1966
He has had active ocular manifestations of BD since 1990
These symptoms recurred and never abated for a long period of time
A right renal cell carcinoma developed and he underwent right nephrectomy in April 1996
Treatment with interferon-alpha was started from June 1996 as supplemental chemotherapy
No active phase developed during administration of IFN-alpha
We suggest that IFN-alpha may play a role as an immunomodulatory agent in BD
